subject: Russ Mitchell: How High Will Gas Prices Go?
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



       May 15, 
      2007

 

Hi,
 
Here's a recap of this morning's 
      Early Show.
 
We 
      began with a look at the skyrocketing cost of gas across the country. Right now, prices are higher than they were just 
      after Hurricane Katrina. There 
      are predictions we could see $4 a gallon gas sometime this summer. 
      
 
Tracy 
      Smith brought us the story of a top fashion designer who wants to put an 
      end to the days of skinny fashion models dominating the runway. He 
      went on his crusade after his own daughter's struggles with trying to stay 
      super-thin.
 
We 
      continued our "Gotta Have It ...The 
      Hard Sell to Kids" series with a look at how advertisers target our youngsters. Julie showed us the 
      latest in handbags for summer. Hannah is in Las Vegas for tonight's Country 
      Music Awards and brought us interviews with Reba McEntire, 
      Brooks & Dunn and Vince 
      Gill. Hannah will be a presenter at 
      tonight's show. 
 
Harry 
      brought us the Tony 
      Award nominations live from Lincoln Center and the original "Cagney and Lacey," Tyne Daly and Sharon Gless, stopped by to talk about the 25th 
      anniversary of the classic CBS drama.
 
We'll 
      have much more tomorrow, 
      including a look back at the career of 
      "The Price is Right" host Bob Barker; a visit with Cameron Diaz, Amy Sedaris 
      and and Cheri Oteri of "Shrek the Third," and a behind-the-scenes look at the new "Pirates of The Caribbean" movie!
 
See 
      you then ...
 
      
Russ MitchellEarlyShow@cbs.com
